About FADC
Building strong youth through the power of dance
Florida Arts and Dance Company is a 501(c)3 not-for-profit Cultural Arts Organization that was founded to provide high quality dance education and performance opportunities to enhance cultural awareness in children and adults. We continue to expand this mission through programs for special needs and at risk children, dance training in a variety of disciplines, adult programs and early childhood programs.
Our studio makes sure that every person who wants to dance is able to, regardless of financial restraints or physical abilities. We also partner with local organizations to serve at-risk youth and special needs children and adults.
Join the FADC Dance Community Today
At FADC, we believe that dance is more than just a sport or a hobby - it's a community. Join us today and become a part of our vibrant, supportive dance family.
Our History
Our Programs
Our History
Founded in 1996, FADC website has been providing high-quality dance education to the community for more than 25 years. Over the years, we have grown into a thriving dance studio with a strong reputation for excellence in dance training.
Our Faculty
Our Programs
Our History
Our faculty is made up of highly trained and experienced dance professionals who are dedicated to helping our students achieve their goals. Our instructors bring a diverse range of dance styles and teaching methods to our studio, creating a unique and dynamic learning environment.
Our Programs
Our Programs
Our Programs
We offer a wide range of programs for dancers of all ages and levels, from recreational classes to pre-professional training. Our programs are designed to provide our students with a comprehensive dance education, including technique, artistry, and performance skills.
Florida Arts & Dance Company Board of Directors
Joann Gallagher, President

Joann Gallagher, President
Joann Gallagher has been a golf club manager in New York, Florida & Massachusetts.  She enjoys being a volunteer for over 20 years serving the Treasure Coast. Joann Gallagher has been a golf club manager in New York, Florida & Massachusetts.  She enjoys being a volunteer for over 20 years serving the Treasure Coast. Joann is the current President of FADC and a member of Women Supporting the Arts.   She was recently honored as the 2022 Reward Recipient of the Marties.  Her past involvement includes Children's Home Society of Florida's Circle of Friends & The Junior League of Martin County.
Show Less
Wendell Cave, Board Member
Joann Gallagher, President
Joann Gallagher, President
Wendell Cave is the owner of Green Grass and High Tides.  He is the current Treasurer of FADC and has volunteered for over 15 years.  He also dances the Father role in the annual production of The Nutcracker each year. He also serves as a Board Member of Gertrude Walden & The Pine School.
Lisa Webb, Board Member
Joann Gallagher, President
Lisa Braun, Board Member
Lisa Maue Webb has been a realtor in Martin County for several years and currently works with Century 21.
Previously, Lisa taught pre-primary at Bridges Montessori and worked for M&T Bank for over 12 years.
Lisa Braun, Board Member
Joann Gallagher, President
Lisa Braun, Board Member
Lisa Braun has been a registered nurse professional for over 30 years practicing on the Treasure Coast . A business owner for over 15 years in both private and not for profit sector. Lisa Braun has been a registered nurse professional for over 30 years practicing on the Treasure Coast . A business owner for over 15 years in both private and not for profit sector. President and Director of Twin Rivers Saddle Club manager of the interscholastic equestrian Association for Twin Rivers Saddle Club here in Martin County. An active member of several boards for youth organizations and geriatric poputlations state wide.
